About.description: An item with user information and settings.

additionalRoleInfo.description: Information about supported additional roles per file type. The most specific type takes precedence.

roleSets.description: The supported additional roles per primary role.

additionalRoles.description: The supported additional roles with the primary role.

type.description: The content type that this additional role info applies to.

domainSharingPolicy.description:
The domain sharing policy for the current user. Possible values are:  
- allowed 
- allowedWithWarning 
- incomingOnly 
- disallowed

source.description: The content type to convert from.

targets.description: The possible content types to convert to.

features.description: List of additional features enabled on this account.

featureRate.description: The request limit rate for this feature, in queries per second.

folderColorPalette.description: The palette of allowable folder colors as RGB hex strings.

source.description: The imported file's content type to convert from.

targets.description: The possible content types to convert to.

isCurrentAppInstalled.description: A boolean indicating whether the authenticated app is installed by the authenticated user.

languageCode.description: The user's language or locale code, as defined by BCP 47, with some extensions from Unicode's LDML format (http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr35/).

maxUploadSizes.description: List of max upload sizes for each file type. The most specific type takes precedence.

size.description: The max upload size for this type.

name.description: The name of the current user.

permissionId.description: The current user's ID as visible in the permissions collection.

quotaBytesByService.description: The amount of storage quota used by different Google services.

bytesUsed.description: The storage quota bytes used by the service.

serviceName.description: The service's name, e.g. DRIVE, GMAIL, or PHOTOS.

quotaBytesTotal.description: The total number of quota bytes.

quotaBytesUsed.description: The number of quota bytes used by Google Drive.

quotaBytesUsedAggregate.description: The number of quota bytes used by all Google apps (Drive, Picasa, etc.).

quotaBytesUsedInTrash.description: The number of quota bytes used by trashed items.

quotaType.description:
The type of the user's storage quota. Possible values are:  
- LIMITED 
- UNLIMITED

remainingChangeIds.description: The number of remaining change ids.

rootFolderId.description: The id of the root folder.

selfLink.description: A link back to this item.

App.description: The apps resource provides a list of the apps that a user has installed, with information about each app's supported MIME types, file extensions, and other details.

authorized.description: Whether the app is authorized to access data on the user's Drive.

createInFolderTemplate.description: The template url to create a new file with this app in a given folder. The template will contain {folderId} to be replaced by the folder to create the new file in.

createUrl.description: The url to create a new file with this app.

hasDriveWideScope.description: Whether the app has drive-wide scope. An app with drive-wide scope can access all files in the user's drive.

icons.description: The various icons for the app.

category.description:
Category of the icon. Allowed values are:  
- application - icon for the application 
- document - icon for a file associated with the app 
- documentShared - icon for a shared file associated with the app

size.description: Size of the icon. Represented as the maximum of the width and height.

longDescription.description: A long description of the app.

objectType.description: The type of object this app creates (e.g. Chart). If empty, the app name should be used instead.

openUrlTemplate.description: The template url for opening files with this app. The template will contain {ids} and/or {exportIds} to be replaced by the actual file ids. See  Open Files  for the full documentation.

primaryFileExtensions.description: The list of primary file extensions.

primaryMimeTypes.description: The list of primary mime types.

productId.description: The ID of the product listing for this app.

productUrl.description: A link to the product listing for this app.

secondaryFileExtensions.description: The list of secondary file extensions.

secondaryMimeTypes.description: The list of secondary mime types.

shortDescription.description: A short description of the app.

supportsCreate.description: Whether this app supports creating new objects.

supportsImport.description: Whether this app supports importing Google Docs.

supportsMultiOpen.description: Whether this app supports opening more than one file.

supportsOfflineCreate.description: Whether this app supports creating new files when offline.

useByDefault.description: Whether the app is selected as the default handler for the types it supports.

AppList.description: A list of third-party applications which the user has installed or given access to Google Drive.

defaultAppIds.description: List of app IDs that the user has specified to use by default. The list is in reverse-priority order (lowest to highest).

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

Change.description: Representation of a change to a file.

deleted.description: Whether the file has been deleted.

file.description: The updated state of the file. Present if the file has not been deleted.

fileId.description: The ID of the file associated with this change.

selfLink.description: A link back to this change.

ChangeList.description: A list of changes for a user.

nextLink.description: A link to the next page of changes.

nextPageToken.description: The page token for the next page of changes.

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

Channel.description: An notification channel used to watch for resource changes.

address.description: The address where notifications are delivered for this channel.

expiration.description: Date and time of notification channel expiration, expressed as a Unix timestamp, in milliseconds. Optional.

id.description: A UUID or similar unique string that identifies this channel.

kind.description: Identifies this as a notification channel used to watch for changes to a resource. Value: the fixed string "api#channel".

additionalProperties.description: Declares a new parameter by name.

params.description: Additional parameters controlling delivery channel behavior. Optional.

payload.description: A Boolean value to indicate whether payload is wanted. Optional.

resourceId.description: An opaque ID that identifies the resource being watched on this channel. Stable across different API versions.

resourceUri.description: A version-specific identifier for the watched resource.

token.description: An arbitrary string delivered to the target address with each notification delivered over this channel. Optional.

type.description: The type of delivery mechanism used for this channel.

ChildList.description: A list of children of a file.

nextLink.description: A link to the next page of children.

nextPageToken.description: The page token for the next page of children.

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

ChildReference.description: A reference to a folder's child.

selfLink.description: A link back to this reference.

Comment.description: A JSON representation of a comment on a file in Google Drive.

anchor.description: A region of the document represented as a JSON string. See anchor documentation for details on how to define and interpret anchor properties.

author.description: The user who wrote this comment.

content.description: The plain text content used to create this comment. This is not HTML safe and should only be used as a starting point to make edits to a comment's content.

context.description: The context of the file which is being commented on.

type.description: The MIME type of the context snippet.

value.description: Data representation of the segment of the file being commented on. In the case of a text file for example, this would be the actual text that the comment is about.

createdDate.description: The date when this comment was first created.

deleted.description: Whether this comment has been deleted. If a comment has been deleted the content will be cleared and this will only represent a comment that once existed.

fileId.description: The file which this comment is addressing.

fileTitle.description: The title of the file which this comment is addressing.

htmlContent.description: HTML formatted content for this comment.

modifiedDate.description: The date when this comment or any of its replies were last modified.

selfLink.description: A link back to this comment.

status.description:
The status of this comment. Status can be changed by posting a reply to a comment with the desired status.  
- "open" - The comment is still open. 
- "resolved" - The comment has been resolved by one of its replies.

CommentList.description: A JSON representation of a list of comments on a file in Google Drive.

nextLink.description: A link to the next page of comments.

nextPageToken.description: The token to use to request the next page of results.

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

CommentReply.description: A JSON representation of a reply to a comment on a file in Google Drive.

author.description: The user who wrote this reply.

content.description: The plain text content used to create this reply. This is not HTML safe and should only be used as a starting point to make edits to a reply's content. This field is required on inserts if no verb is specified (resolve/reopen).

createdDate.description: The date when this reply was first created.

deleted.description: Whether this reply has been deleted. If a reply has been deleted the content will be cleared and this will only represent a reply that once existed.

htmlContent.description: HTML formatted content for this reply.

modifiedDate.description: The date when this reply was last modified.

verb.description:
The action this reply performed to the parent comment. When creating a new reply this is the action to be perform to the parent comment. Possible values are:  
- "resolve" - To resolve a comment. 
- "reopen" - To reopen (un-resolve) a comment.

CommentReplyList.description: A JSON representation of a list of replies to a comment on a file in Google Drive.

nextLink.description: A link to the next page of replies.

nextPageToken.description: The token to use to request the next page of results.

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

alternateLink.description: A link for opening the file in a relevant Google editor or viewer.

appDataContents.description: Whether this file is in the Application Data folder.

canComment.description: Whether the current user can comment on the file.

copyable.description: Whether the file can be copied by the current user.

createdDate.description: Create time for this file (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

defaultOpenWithLink.description: A link to open this file with the user's default app for this file. Only populated when the drive.apps.readonly scope is used.

description.description: A short description of the file.

editable.description: Whether the file can be edited by the current user.

embedLink.description: A link for embedding the file.

explicitlyTrashed.description: Whether this file has been explicitly trashed, as opposed to recursively trashed.

additionalProperties.description: A mapping from export format to URL

exportLinks.description: Links for exporting Google Docs to specific formats.

fileExtension.description: The final component of fullFileExtension with trailing text that does not appear to be part of the extension removed. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.

fileSize.description: The size of the file in bytes. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.

folderColorRgb.description: Folder color as an RGB hex string if the file is a folder. The list of supported colors is available in the folderColorPalette field of the About resource. If an unsupported color is specified, it will be changed to the closest color in the palette.

fullFileExtension.description: The full file extension; extracted from the title. May contain multiple concatenated extensions, such as "tar.gz". Removing an extension from the title does not clear this field; however, changing the extension on the title does update this field. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.

headRevisionId.description: The ID of the file's head revision. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.

iconLink.description: A link to the file's icon.

imageMediaMetadata.description: Metadata about image media. This will only be present for image types, and its contents will depend on what can be parsed from the image content.

aperture.description: The aperture used to create the photo (f-number).

cameraMake.description: The make of the camera used to create the photo.

cameraModel.description: The model of the camera used to create the photo.

colorSpace.description: The color space of the photo.

date.description: The date and time the photo was taken (EXIF format timestamp).

exposureBias.description: The exposure bias of the photo (APEX value).

exposureMode.description: The exposure mode used to create the photo.

exposureTime.description: The length of the exposure, in seconds.

flashUsed.description: Whether a flash was used to create the photo.

focalLength.description: The focal length used to create the photo, in millimeters.

height.description: The height of the image in pixels.

isoSpeed.description: The ISO speed used to create the photo.

lens.description: The lens used to create the photo.

location.description: Geographic location information stored in the image.

altitude.description: The altitude stored in the image.

latitude.description: The latitude stored in the image.

longitude.description: The longitude stored in the image.

maxApertureValue.description: The smallest f-number of the lens at the focal length used to create the photo (APEX value).

meteringMode.description: The metering mode used to create the photo.

rotation.description: The rotation in clockwise degrees from the image's original orientation.

sensor.description: The type of sensor used to create the photo.

subjectDistance.description: The distance to the subject of the photo, in meters.

whiteBalance.description: The white balance mode used to create the photo.

width.description: The width of the image in pixels.

indexableText.description: Indexable text attributes for the file (can only be written)

text.description: The text to be indexed for this file.

kind.description: The type of file. This is always drive#file.

labels.description: A group of labels for the file.

restricted.description: Whether viewers and commenters are prevented from downloading, printing, and copying this file.

starred.description: Whether this file is starred by the user.

trashed.description: Whether this file has been trashed. This label applies to all users accessing the file; however, only owners are allowed to see and untrash files.

viewed.description: Whether this file has been viewed by this user.

lastModifyingUser.description: The last user to modify this file.

lastModifyingUserName.description: Name of the last user to modify this file.

lastViewedByMeDate.description: Last time this file was viewed by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

markedViewedByMeDate.description: Time this file was explicitly marked viewed by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

md5Checksum.description: An MD5 checksum for the content of this file. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the file. This is only mutable on update when uploading new content. This field can be left blank, and the mimetype will be determined from the uploaded content's MIME type.

modifiedByMeDate.description: Last time this file was modified by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). Note that setting modifiedDate will also update the modifiedByMe date for the user which set the date.

modifiedDate.description: Last time this file was modified by anyone (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). This is only mutable on update when the setModifiedDate parameter is set.

openWithLinks.description: A map of the id of each of the user's apps to a link to open this file with that app. Only populated when the drive.apps.readonly scope is used.

originalFilename.description: The original filename if the file was uploaded manually, or the original title if the file was inserted through the API. Note that renames of the title will not change the original filename. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.

ownedByMe.description: Whether the file is owned by the current user.

ownerNames.description: Name(s) of the owner(s) of this file.

parents.description:
Collection of parent folders which contain this file.
Setting this field will put the file in all of the provided folders. On insert, if no folders are provided, the file will be placed in the default root folder.

permissions.description: The list of permissions for users with access to this file.

quotaBytesUsed.description: The number of quota bytes used by this file.

selfLink.description: A link back to this file.

shareable.description: Whether the file's sharing settings can be modified by the current user.

shared.description: Whether the file has been shared.

sharedWithMeDate.description: Time at which this file was shared with the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

sharingUser.description: User that shared the item with the current user, if available.

spaces.description: The list of spaces which contain the file. Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder' and 'photos'.

thumbnail.description: Thumbnail for the file. Only accepted on upload and for files that are not already thumbnailed by Google.

image.description: The URL-safe Base64 encoded bytes of the thumbnail image. It should conform to RFC 4648 section 5.

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the thumbnail.

thumbnailLink.description: A short-lived link to the file's thumbnail. Typically lasts on the order of hours.

userPermission.description: The permissions for the authenticated user on this file.

version.description: A monotonically increasing version number for the file. This reflects every change made to the file on the server, even those not visible to the requesting user.

videoMediaMetadata.description: Metadata about video media. This will only be present for video types.

durationMillis.description: The duration of the video in milliseconds.

height.description: The height of the video in pixels.

width.description: The width of the video in pixels.

webContentLink.description: A link for downloading the content of the file in a browser using cookie based authentication. In cases where the content is shared publicly, the content can be downloaded without any credentials.

webViewLink.description: A link only available on public folders for viewing their static web assets (HTML, CSS, JS, etc) via Google Drive's Website Hosting.

writersCanShare.description: Whether writers can share the document with other users.

nextLink.description: A link to the next page of files.

nextPageToken.description: The page token for the next page of files.

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

GeneratedIds.description: A list of generated IDs which can be provided in insert requests

ids.description: The IDs generated for the requesting user in the specified space.

space.description: The type of file that can be created with these IDs.

ParentList.description: A list of a file's parents.

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

ParentReference.description: A reference to a file's parent.

isRoot.description: Whether or not the parent is the root folder.

selfLink.description: A link back to this reference.

additionalRoles.description: Additional roles for this user. Only commenter is currently allowed.

authKey.description: The authkey parameter required for this permission.

domain.description: The domain name of the entity this permission refers to. This is an output-only field which is present when the permission type is user, group or domain.

emailAddress.description: The email address of the user or group this permission refers to. This is an output-only field which is present when the permission type is user or group.

id.description: The ID of the user this permission refers to, and identical to the permissionId in the About and Files resources. When making a drive.permissions.insert request, exactly one of the id or value fields must be specified.

photoLink.description: A link to the profile photo, if available.

role.description:
The primary role for this user. Allowed values are:  
- owner 
- reader 
- writer

selfLink.description: A link back to this permission.

type.description:
The account type. Allowed values are:  
- user 
- group 
- domain 
- anyone

value.description: The email address or domain name for the entity. This is used during inserts and is not populated in responses. When making a drive.permissions.insert request, exactly one of the id or value fields must be specified.

withLink.description: Whether the link is required for this permission.

PermissionId.description: An ID for a user or group as seen in Permission items.

PermissionList.description: A list of permissions associated with a file.

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

Property.description:
A key-value pair attached to a file that is either public or private to an application.
The following limits apply to file properties:  
- Maximum of 100 properties total per file
- Maximum of 30 private properties per app
- Maximum of 30 public properties
- Maximum of 124 bytes size limit on (key + value) string in UTF-8 encoding for a single property.

selfLink.description: The link back to this property.

PropertyList.description: A collection of properties, key-value pairs that are either public or private to an application.

selfLink.description: The link back to this list.

downloadUrl.description: Short term download URL for the file. This will only be populated on files with content stored in Drive.

additionalProperties.description: A mapping from export format to URL

exportLinks.description: Links for exporting Google Docs to specific formats.

fileSize.description: The size of the revision in bytes. This will only be populated on files with content stored in Drive.

lastModifyingUser.description: The last user to modify this revision.

lastModifyingUserName.description: Name of the last user to modify this revision.

md5Checksum.description: An MD5 checksum for the content of this revision. This will only be populated on files with content stored in Drive.

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the revision.

modifiedDate.description: Last time this revision was modified (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

originalFilename.description: The original filename when this revision was created. This will only be populated on files with content stored in Drive.

pinned.description: Whether this revision is pinned to prevent automatic purging. This will only be populated and can only be modified on files with content stored in Drive which are not Google Docs. Revisions can also be pinned when they are created through the drive.files.insert/update/copy by using the pinned query parameter.

publishAuto.description: Whether subsequent revisions will be automatically republished. This is only populated and can only be modified for Google Docs.

published.description: Whether this revision is published. This is only populated and can only be modified for Google Docs.

publishedLink.description: A link to the published revision.

publishedOutsideDomain.description: Whether this revision is published outside the domain. This is only populated and can only be modified for Google Docs.

selfLink.description: A link back to this revision.

RevisionList.description: A list of revisions of a file.

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

User.description: The JSON template for a user.

displayName.description: A plain text displayable name for this user.

emailAddress.description: The email address of the user.

isAuthenticatedUser.description: Whether this user is the same as the authenticated user for whom the request was made.

permissionId.description: The user's ID as visible in the permissions collection.

url.description: A URL that points to a profile picture of this user.

info.description: The API to interact with Drive.
info.title: Drive API

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.
fields.name: fields

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.
key.name: key

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.
oauth_token.name: oauth_token

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.
prettyPrint.name: prettyPrint

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.
quotaUser.name: quotaUser

userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.
userIp.name: userIp

get.description: Gets the information about the current user along with Drive API settings

parameters.description: When calculating the number of remaining change IDs, whether to include public files the user has opened and shared files. When set to false, this counts only change IDs for owned files and any shared or public files that the user has explicitly added to a folder they own.
parameters.name: includeSubscribed

parameters.description: Maximum number of remaining change IDs to count
parameters.name: maxChangeIdCount

parameters.description: Change ID to start counting from when calculating number of remaining change IDs
parameters.name: startChangeId

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of file extensions for open with filtering. All apps within the given app query scope which can open any of the given file extensions will be included in the response. If appFilterMimeTypes are provided as well, the result is a union of the two resulting app lists.
parameters.name: appFilterExtensions

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of MIME types for open with filtering. All apps within the given app query scope which can open any of the given MIME types will be included in the response. If appFilterExtensions are provided as well, the result is a union of the two resulting app lists.
parameters.name: appFilterMimeTypes

parameters.description: A language or locale code, as defined by BCP 47, with some extensions from Unicode's LDML format (http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr35/).
parameters.name: languageCode

parameters.description: The ID of the app.
parameters.name: appId

get.description: Lists the changes for a user.

parameters.description: Whether to include deleted items.
parameters.name: includeDeleted

parameters.description: Whether to include public files the user has opened and shared files. When set to false, the list only includes owned files plus any shared or public files the user has explicitly added to a folder they own.
parameters.name: includeSubscribed

parameters.description: Maximum number of changes to return.
parameters.name: maxResults

parameters.description: Page token for changes.
parameters.name: pageToken

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of spaces to query. Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder' and 'photos'.
parameters.name: spaces

parameters.description: Change ID to start listing changes from.
parameters.name: startChangeId

post.description: Subscribe to changes for a user.

parameters.description: Whether to include deleted items.
parameters.name: includeDeleted

parameters.description: Whether to include public files the user has opened and shared files. When set to false, the list only includes owned files plus any shared or public files the user has explicitly added to a folder they own.
parameters.name: includeSubscribed

parameters.description: Maximum number of changes to return.
parameters.name: maxResults

parameters.description: Page token for changes.
parameters.name: pageToken

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of spaces to query. Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder' and 'photos'.
parameters.name: spaces

parameters.description: Change ID to start listing changes from.
parameters.name: startChangeId

parameters.description: The ID of the change.
parameters.name: changeId

post.description: Stop watching resources through this channel

parameters.description: The body of items (files/documents) to which the query applies.
parameters.name: corpus

parameters.description: Maximum number of files to return.
parameters.name: maxResults

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of sort keys. Valid keys are 'createdDate', 'folder', 'lastViewedByMeDate', 'modifiedByMeDate', 'modifiedDate', 'quotaBytesUsed', 'recency', 'sharedWithMeDate', 'starred', and 'title'. Each key sorts ascending by default, but may be reversed with the 'desc' modifier. Example usage: ?orderBy=folder,modifiedDate desc,title. Please note that there is a current limitation for users with approximately one million files in which the requested sort order is ignored.
parameters.name: orderBy

parameters.description: Page token for files.
parameters.name: pageToken

parameters.description: This parameter is deprecated and has no function.
parameters.name: projection

parameters.description: Query string for searching files.
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of spaces to query. Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder' and 'photos'.
parameters.name: spaces

parameters.description: Whether to convert this file to the corresponding Google Docs format.
parameters.name: convert

parameters.description: Whether to attempt OCR on .jpg, .png, .gif, or .pdf uploads.
parameters.name: ocr

parameters.description: If ocr is true, hints at the language to use. Valid values are BCP 47 codes.
parameters.name: ocrLanguage

parameters.description: Whether to pin the head revision of the uploaded file. A file can have a maximum of 200 pinned revisions.
parameters.name: pinned

parameters.description: The language of the timed text.
parameters.name: timedTextLanguage

parameters.description: The timed text track name.
parameters.name: timedTextTrackName

parameters.description: Whether to use the content as indexable text.
parameters.name: useContentAsIndexableText

parameters.description: The visibility of the new file. This parameter is only relevant when convert=false.
parameters.name: visibility

get.description: Generates a set of file IDs which can be provided in insert requests.

parameters.description: Maximum number of IDs to return.
parameters.name: maxResults

parameters.description: The space in which the IDs can be used to create new files. Supported values are 'drive' and 'appDataFolder'.
parameters.name: space

delete.description: Permanently deletes all of the user's trashed files.
Permanently deletes a file by ID. Skips the trash. The currently authenticated user must own the file.

parameters.description: The ID of the file to delete.
parameters.name: fileId

get.description: Gets a file's metadata by ID.

parameters.description: The ID for the file in question.
parameters.name: fileId

parameters.description: Whether the user is acknowledging the risk of downloading known malware or other abusive files.
parameters.name: acknowledgeAbuse

parameters.description: This parameter is deprecated and has no function.
parameters.name: projection

parameters.description: Specifies the Revision ID that should be downloaded. Ignored unless alt=media is specified.
parameters.name: revisionId

parameters.description: Deprecated: Use files.update with modifiedDateBehavior=noChange, updateViewedDate=true and an empty request body.
parameters.name: updateViewedDate

patch.description: Updates file metadata and/or content. This method supports patch semantics.

parameters.description: The ID of the file to update.
parameters.name: fileId

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of parent IDs to add.
parameters.name: addParents

parameters.description: This parameter is deprecated and has no function.
parameters.name: convert

parameters.description: Determines the behavior in which modifiedDate is updated. This overrides setModifiedDate.
parameters.name: modifiedDateBehavior

parameters.description: Whether a blob upload should create a new revision. If false, the blob data in the current head revision is replaced. If true or not set, a new blob is created as head revision, and previous unpinned revisions are preserved for a short period of time. Pinned revisions are stored indefinitely, using additional storage quota, up to a maximum of 200 revisions. For details on how revisions are retained, see the Drive Help Center.
parameters.name: newRevision

parameters.description: Whether to attempt OCR on .jpg, .png, .gif, or .pdf uploads.
parameters.name: ocr

parameters.description: If ocr is true, hints at the language to use. Valid values are BCP 47 codes.
parameters.name: ocrLanguage

parameters.description: Whether to pin the new revision. A file can have a maximum of 200 pinned revisions.
parameters.name: pinned

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of parent IDs to remove.
parameters.name: removeParents

parameters.description: Whether to set the modified date with the supplied modified date.
parameters.name: setModifiedDate

parameters.description: The language of the timed text.
parameters.name: timedTextLanguage

parameters.description: The timed text track name.
parameters.name: timedTextTrackName

parameters.description: Whether to update the view date after successfully updating the file.

parameters.description: Whether a blob upload should create a new revision. If false, the blob data in the current head revision is replaced. If true or not set, a new blob is created as head revision, and previous unpinned revisions are preserved for a short period of time. Pinned revisions are stored indefinitely, using additional storage quota, up to a maximum of 200 revisions. For details on how revisions are retained, see the Drive Help Center.

put.description: Overwrites the Realtime API data model associated with this file with the provided JSON data model.

parameters.description: The ID of the file that the Realtime API data model is associated with.
parameters.name: fileId

parameters.description: The revision of the model to diff the uploaded model against. If set, the uploaded model is diffed against the provided revision and those differences are merged with any changes made to the model after the provided revision. If not set, the uploaded model replaces the current model on the server.

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of sort keys. Valid keys are 'createdDate', 'folder', 'lastViewedByMeDate', 'modifiedByMeDate', 'modifiedDate', 'quotaBytesUsed', 'recency', 'sharedWithMeDate', 'starred', and 'title'. Each key sorts ascending by default, but may be reversed with the 'desc' modifier. Example usage: ?orderBy=folder,modifiedDate desc,title. Please note that there is a current limitation for users with approximately one million files in which the requested sort order is ignored.
parameters.name: orderBy

scopes.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive: View and manage the files in your Google Drive
scopes.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.ap: View and manage its own configuration data in your Google Drive
scopes.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.fi: View and manage Google Drive files and folders that you have opened or created with this app
scopes.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.me: View and manage metadata of files in your Google Drive
View metadata for files in your Google Drive
scopes.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.ph: View the photos, videos and albums in your Google Photos
scopes.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.re: View the files in your Google Drive
scopes.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.sc: Modify your Google Apps Script scripts' behavior
